properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 9 at 1:39PM MST until January 10 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 TO 7 inches
with locally higher amounts. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...Snowy and Sierra Madre Ranges.

* WHEN...From 5 AM early this morning to 11 AM MST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact travel on area roads. Poor visibility
could lead to snow mobilers and outdoor enthusiasts becoming
disoriented or lost. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below
zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will
cause travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and
limited visibilities...and use caution while driving.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST FRIDAY
